onvenient

of
the test to

n what
problem you

e about this?
> 
> I also miss getName() and an object model representing t=
ests.  I've
> found the disappearance of JUnit's domain model in version 4
=
> problematic a few times.
> 
> Most recently, I wanted to record and save =
desktop videos of failing
> tests that exercised the GUI.  I did this by at=
taching a test listener
> using the Ant JUnit runner (actually an output fo=
rmatter in Ant-lingo,
> but it inherits from test listener) which started r=
ecording a video
> file when the test started and stopped recording when th=
e test
> finished.  The video file was named after the test.  It worked fin=
e in
> JUnit 3.  However, the JUnit4 adapter did not expose methods to let =
me
> calculate the name of the file from the test class and method names.
>=
 
> --Nat
